subject: Travel
title: Marco Polo's Journey
description: Learn Marco Polo's Journey in one minute.

hook.text: In 1271, a 17-year-old Venetian set out for China with his father and uncle. The trip took four years.

buildup.text: Marco Polo crossed deserts, mountains, and war zones to reach the court of Kublai Khan.

discovery.text: The Khan made Polo an envoy. He spent 17 years in China, traveling where no European had gone.

twist.text: When Polo returned to Venice and wrote his story, most people thought he was lying.

climax.text: On his deathbed, friends begged him to admit he made it up. He said, 'I didn't tell half of it.'

punchline.text: The truth was stranger than anyone believed.

quiz.question: How long did Marco Polo stay in China?
